docs.lead_paragraph: Republican Jeb Bush's initial foray into New Hampshire has shown that he may have learned from the mistakes his father and brother made in losing the state that will be crucial for him should he run for president in 2016.

headline.main: In New Hampshire, Jeb Bush Goes 'Up Close and Personal'
headline.print_headline: In New Hampshire, Jeb Bush Goes 'Up Close and Personal'

docs.snippet: Republican Jeb Bush's initial foray into New Hampshire has shown that he may have learned from the mistakes his father and brother made in losing the state that will be crucial for him should he run for president in 2016.

docs.lead_paragraph: If you're among the several million people hit with new federal fines for going without health insurance, then starting Sunday you'll get a second chance to sign up for 2015 coverage through HealthCare.gov.

headline.main: Cool Reception for New Sign-Up Window Under Health Care Law
headline.print_headline: Cool Reception for New Sign-Up Window Under Health Care Law

docs.snippet: If you're among the several million people hit with new federal fines for going without health insurance, then starting Sunday you'll get a second chance to sign up for 2015 coverage through HealthCare.gov.

docs.lead_paragraph: Many government programs are needlessly complicated, and the Social Security system is one of the worst. A new book tries to guide the unwary.

headline.main: The Social Security Maze and Other U.S. Mysteries
headline.print_headline: The Social Security Maze and Other U.S. Mysteries

docs.abstract: Ron Lieber Your Money column examines how runaway success of Philip Moeller, Laurence J Kotlikoff and Paul Solman book Get What's Yours, guide to Social Security, underscores lamentable complexity of modern American financial lives; suggests that every American should be ashamed that they live in nation where guides like Get What's Yours are necessary to navigate confusing system.
docs.snippet: Many government programs are needlessly complicated, and the Social Security system is one of the worst. A new book tries to guide the unwary.

docs.lead_paragraph: In a rare show of unity, top House Republicans and Democrats are working toward an agreement permanently revamping how doctors are paid for treating Medicare patients, a package that lobbyists said would cost $200 billion or more and be largely financed by adding to the federal deficit.

headline.main: House Leaders Work Toward Bipartisan Medicare Deal
headline.print_headline: House Leaders Work Toward Bipartisan Medicare Deal

docs.snippet: In a rare show of unity, top House Republicans and Democrats are working toward an agreement permanently revamping how doctors are paid for treating Medicare patients, a package that lobbyists said would cost $200 billion or more and be largely...

docs.lead_paragraph: Unscrupulous tax preparers are using President Barack Obama's health care law as a ploy to pocket bogus fines from unsuspecting taxpayers, including some immigrants not bound by the law's requirements, the IRS warned Friday.

headline.main: IRS Warns of Tax Scams Involving Health Care Law
headline.print_headline: IRS Warns of Tax Scams Involving Health Care Law

docs.snippet: Unscrupulous tax preparers are using President Barack Obama's health care law as a ploy to pocket bogus fines from unsuspecting taxpayers, including some immigrants not bound by the law's requirements, the IRS warned Friday.

headline.main: Morning Agenda: Commerzbank in U.S. Settlement

docs.abstract: Commerzbank agrees to pay nearly $1.5 billion in U.S. settlement. | How 3 banks passed the Fed’s stress tests. | The Gates Foundation is investing directly in for-profit companies with bright ideas.
docs.snippet: Commerzbank agrees to pay nearly $1.5 billion in U.S. settlement. | How 3 banks passed the Fed’s stress tests. | The Gates Foundation is investing directly in for-profit companies with bright ideas.

docs.lead_paragraph: Many drivers say the systems are unfair, but communities say they make money and reduce accidents.

headline.main: Red-Light Camera Debate Is a Stew of Anger, Revenue and Safety
headline.print_headline: Red-Light Camera Debate Is a Stew of Anger, Revenue and Safety

docs.abstract: Wheels column; many drivers question whether red-light cameras are used to prevent accidents or to generate revenue through tickets sent in mail; cities and towns say cameras are deterrent that aids in improving traffic safety.
docs.snippet: Many drivers say the systems are unfair, but communities say they make money and reduce accidents.

headline.main: What Happens as More States Curtail Labor's Rights?

docs.lead_paragraph: Since the Department of Justice released a scathing report, the city manager and Municipal Court judge have also stepped down.

headline.main: Ferguson Police Chief Thomas Jackson Joins Exodus of City Officials
headline.print_headline: Police Chief Joins Exodus in Ferguson

docs.abstract: Thomas Jackson, embattled police chief of Ferguson, Mo, is latest official to resign after Justice Dept report condemns city's culture of discriminatory policing; joins city manager John Shaw and municipal court Judge Ronald J Brockmeyer, all three of whom had been cited as key figures in abuses, in stepping down.
docs.snippet: Since the Department of Justice released a scathing report, the city manager and Municipal Court judge have also stepped down.

docs.lead_paragraph: Professor Arras, who taught bioethics at the University of Virginia, urged doctors to consider fairness and morality in their decisions.

headline.main: John D. Arras, Medical Care Philosopher, Is Dead at 69
headline.print_headline: John D. Arras, Medical Care Philosopher, Is Dead at 69

docs.abstract: John D Arras, who taught bioethics, preaching that doctors should consider fairness and morality in their medical decisions, dies at age 69.
docs.snippet: Professor Arras, who taught bioethics at the University of Virginia, urged doctors to consider fairness and morality in their decisions.
